msg.description: Any English sentence, meant as information for developers and implementers. Avoid displaying this to the users and especially do not expect thos messages to stay stable.

msg_localised.description: Optional localised message that can be displayed to the user if existing. The language can be set by in the request or will fallback to English.

id.description: The request uuid that can be used to identify and trace API calls.

host.description: Server host and protocol from which request was handled.

count.description: the length of the results array.

results.description: The envelope of items, that are usually objects. We are generally sending back arrays even if there was just one requested resource.

id.description: The uuid v4 that is generated on the API when a transaction is received. This id can be used for idempotency

created_at.description: The server creation time of this transaction.

channel.description: The channel of which this transaction originated from. Usually this is the API, but may be experimental implementations of other channels.

client_account.description: The Tillhub client account ID. Note: this will usually be a uuid v4, however you might receive a capitalised dash-stripped version of it, if you hold a legsacy account.

receipt.description: The Tillhub merchant receipt resource ID.

date.description: A user defined [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) compliant date e.g. 2018-01-29T14:55:05.000Z. This is used to track local client time as oppsed to `created_at`, which is the time the server has received it. This is necessary for e.g. offline client, and is valid time in fiscal reports.

oneOf.description: A implementer defined identifier. This can be used for local resource matching and has no business implication.
Any string that a user wants to store to identify a transaction, or wants to make it human readable.
Any string that a user wants to store to identify a previous transaction.
The Tillhub branch location ID.
The Tillhub branch number.
The Tillhub register location ID.
The Tillhub register number.
(MANDANT) The Tillhub client location ID.
(MANDANT) The Tillhub client number.
The Tillhub staff resource ID, that has generated this transaction. (used by temp staff)
The Tillhub staff (as cashier) resource ID, that has generated this transaction.
The Tillhub POS client ID, that was generated upon install, that has generated this transaction.
Any additional flat values.
Old school transaction custom ID.
Any arbitrary title.
Transaction specific counters.

signing_error.description: Number of failed signing attempts in a row.

oneOf.description: Register face values.
Branch face values.
Cashier face values.
Customer face values.
The Tillhub balance resource ID of the last balance.
The last balance's `custom_id`, that usually fiscally referred to as the balance number.
The next desired balance number on that register.
Any identifier a user wants to store in the transaction system. E.g. an ID in a thirdy party ERP.
A generic reference container as a user defined object.
The Tillhub customer resource ID, that this transaction has been generated for.
An user defined customer reference.

oneOf.example: Did this sale. Went to the next one.
oneOf.description: Any arbitrary comment.

data.description: A barcade container of any type with which this transaction is associated.

oneOf.description: A container for storing arbitrary metadata. This might be altered by API.

items.description: Total sum per currency of applied discounts as they happened at transaction creation time.

oneOf.description: Described whether a transaction was a originated by any other device or service that is not directly inside the client account. This can be online systems, external systems or other Tillhub POS clients inside other client accounts.
A list of Tillhub resources that caused this transaction, e.g. a stored cart or multiple delivery notes

items.description: Reference to a similar type of object (e.g. transaction to cart)

oneOf.description: A Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.
The custom_id of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.

date.description: The date of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: A list of Tillhub resources that this transaction directly depends on, e.g. a refund for a previous sale

items.description: Reference to the same type of object (e.g. transaction to pervious transaction)

oneOf.description: A Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.
The custom_id of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.
The client_id of a Tillhub transaction or item that this reference links to.

date.description: The date of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: A list of Tillhub resources that this transaction is related to, e.g. an invoice object that tracks the lifetime of that invoice

items.description: Reference to a very different type of object (e.g. transaction to invoice or expense to safe)

id.description: A Tillhub resource that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: Geospatial data of this transaction

currency.description: The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this item.

amount_total_gross.description: The payable net amount total, after decrementing applicable discounts etc. This value needs to be lower than or equal to the respective unti amount.

amount_total_net.description: The payable net amount total, after decrementing applicable discounts etc. This value needs to be lower than or equal to the respective unti amount.

sub_total.description: The payable amount before decrementing applicable discounts. Net or Gross based on tax scheme.

insert_id.description: The sequential database insert ID. Consecutiveness is not guaranteed.

hashes.description: Hashes to check consistency of the data fields of this transactions that are hashable.

sha512_v0.description: The v0 implementation of the transaction hash

block.description: The block this transaction is stored in and it's references.

previous.description: The previous transaction on the server. Consecutiveness is server only. Stale offline transactions are not accommodated here.

exchange_rates.description: The relevant exchange rates of this transaction at transaction time.

created_at.description: The server creation time of this transaction.

amount.description: The payable amount on the units qty base of 1.

amount_total.description: The payable amount. Amount multiplied by qty.

revenue.description: The total of this item excluding decrements like discounts.

oneOf.description: A implementer defined identifier. This can be used for local resource matching and has no business implication.
The position description of the item. E.g. positon 1 (2, 3 etc.) in the cart.
The quantity of this item.
The metric unit of this item. E.g. 1.754 kg(!) vegetables.

date.description: A user defined [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) compliant date e.g. 2018-01-29T14:55:05.000Z. This is used to track local client time as oppsed to `created_at`, which is the time the server has received it. This is necessary for e.g. offline client, and is valid time in fiscal reports. If none is provided it will default to the transaction's date.

name.description: The nomenclature for this item, which is fiscally required.

currency.description: The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this item.

oneOf.description: The Tillhub product resource reference ID.
Any custom ID, e.g. a product number
If a single tax applies (normally VAT) - the applicable Tillhub tax resource with tax accounts.

vat_rate.description: The VAT rate of this item. E.g. 0.19 for 19% German VAT. If no VAT applies, set to 0.

oneOf.description: The Tillhub branch location ID.
The Tillhub register location ID.
The Tillhub staff (as salesman) resource ID, that has generated this transaction.
The applicable Tillhub tax resource.

tax.description: The applicable Tillhub tax resource with tax accounts.

oneOf.description: Custom tax account number identifier.
Custom tax account description.
Item property changes triggered by a user decision.

tax_switched.description: Indicates if the tax was switched (e.g. by a matching configured button).

oneOf.description: Description of a specific user action that could cause automatic tax switches.

name.description: Name of the specific user action

tax.description: The applicable Tillhub tax resource with tax accounts that is associated with this user action and can trigger a tax switch.

oneOf.description: The applicable Tillhub (revenue or EXPENSE) account.
The Tillhub product group resource reference ID.

tax_amount.description: The tax amount on the per unit qty base of 1.

discount_amount.description: The discount amount on the per unit qty base of 1.

items.description: Any applied discounts as they happened at transaction creation time.

amount.description: The effective amount for this discount per item qty base 1

amount_total.description: The effective amount for this discount per qty items

value.description: The absolute reduction via this discounting object e.g. a value discount.

rate.description: The relative reduction via this voucher

client_id.description: Client id to map this object back

external_reference_id.description: A caller defined custom ID for the purpose of syncing from external resources, or to use in analytics.

oneOf.description: The effective type of the discounting object.

source_id.description: The Tillhub discounting resource (if available) e.g. a discount, promotion etc.

assignment_id.description: Identification of the client process that created this discount

assignment_source.description: Identification of the client source of the process that created this discount

is_automatic.description: If true, this discount was trigger automatically.

oneOf.description: A map of attributes of this transaction item, e.g. product properties

stock_change_enabled.description: The flag that describes whether an actual stock change was enabled or overridden at transaction time.

oneOf.description: A list of Tillhub resources that caused this transaction, e.g. a stored cart or multiple delivery notes

items.description: Reference to a similar type of object (e.g. transaction to cart)

oneOf.description: A Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.
The custom_id of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.

date.description: The date of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: A list of Tillhub resources that this transaction directly depends on, e.g. a refund for a previous sale

items.description: Reference to the same type of object (e.g. transaction to pervious transaction)

oneOf.description: A Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.
The custom_id of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.
The client_id of a Tillhub transaction or item that this reference links to.

date.description: The date of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: A list of Tillhub resources that this transaction is related to, e.g. an invoice object that tracks the lifetime of that invoice

items.description: Reference to a very different type of object (e.g. transaction to invoice or expense to safe)

id.description: A Tillhub resource that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: A list of answers to product service questions

items.description: Answer to a product service question

id.description: A Tillhub product question resource identifier.

question.description: The associated Tillhub product question 'content' field.

type.description: The required layout type of the answer

content_type.description: The required content type of the answer

required.description: If true, the answer is mandatory

answer.description: The answer content of a product service question

oneOf.description: If 'number_input_plus_optional_unit_select', this field contains the inputted numerical value.
If 'checkbox', this field contains the selcetd boolean value.
If 'free_text_input' or 'simple_select', this field contains the inputted text.
If 'number_input_plus_optional_unit_select', this field contains the selected unit.
Any additional flat values.
Any arbitrary title.
Account face values.
In case of a single tax (usually VAT) - the tax account face values.
Product face values.
Product face values.
Salesman face values.
The effective voucher delta record for this item (thus reversable if needed)

client_id.description: A implementer defined identifier. This can be used for local resource matching and has no business implication. TO BE DEPRECTAED.

source_id.description: The Tillhub or Fleurop Id of the source voucher.

delta_amount.description: The effective change in the value of the voucher or it's creation amount $1.37 = 1.37.

delta_currency.description: The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this item.

external.description: Make this voucher to follow external logic

external_system_type.description: Define which voucher API implementation to follow

external_system_id.description: Define here whether this voucher system is an external one and which ID it references at the provider. E.g. a Tillhub Account can talk to another one, but permissions and this reference need to be set.

oneOf.description: Replace own accountId with external_system_id in requests when external=true, i.e. /vouchers/external_system_id/voucher_id. If external=false use accountId as usual, i.e. /vouchers/accountId/voucher_id

external_voucher_system_id.description: If using a parent's voucher system, this is the voucher system id of the delegating parent. external_voucher_system_id is to be sent in requests as a query parameter, whenever external_system_id (instead of the own accountId) is used in the url, e.g. vouchers/{external_system_id}/lookup?code=xyz123&system={external_voucher_system_id}.

oneOf.description: Additional parameter for external voucher systems, e.g. Fleurop Voucher Type specifier or id inside external system
If action_type is 'create' - a reference to the voucher template used
Title of the source voucher.

type.description: Mainly legacy support for Fleurop flows.

status.description: Client side recorded booking state of the delta operation.

oneOf.description: Information about a returned item.
The associated Tillhub reason resource.
The  Tillhub reason resource's name.

oneOf.example: Accidentally charged the customer for products he did not buy
oneOf.description: The  Tillhub reason resource's description.

oneOf.example: Cashier entered here a custom reason.
oneOf.description: A client side user defined custom description for this return process.
Copy of the behavior object from the reasons table.

oneOf.example: Did this sale. Went to the next one.
oneOf.description: Any arbitrary comment.
Any identifier a user wants to store in the transaction system. E.g. an ID in a thirdy party ERP.
A generic reference container as a user defined object.

amount_net.description: The payable net amount on the units qty base of 1, after decrementing applicable discounts etc. This value needs to be lower than or equal to the respective unti amount.

amount_gross.description: The payable gross amount on the units qty base of 1, after decrementing applicable discounts etc.  This value needs to be lower than or equal to the respective unti amount.

amount_total_net.description: The payable net amount total, after decrementing applicable discounts etc. This value needs to be lower than or equal to the respective unti amount.

amount_total_gross.description: The payable net amount total, after decrementing applicable discounts etc. This value needs to be lower than or equal to the respective unti amount.

amount_unit_net.description: The original qty base 1 item net amount, e.g. the product shelf price

amount_unit_gross.description: The original qty base 1 item net amount, e.g. the product shelf price

insert_id.description: The sequential database insert ID. Consecutiveness is not guaranteed.

client_account.description: The Tillhub client account ID. Note: this will usually be a uuid v4, however you might receive a capitalised dash-stripped version of it, if you hold a legsacy account.

oneOf.description: The Tillhub stock resource reference ID. Stock is the tracking system on a per location per product basis.
The embedded stock change.
The Tillhub stock book resource reference ID. Stock book items describe the stock change, e.g. from / to, qty etc..

created_at.description: The server creation time of this transaction.

oneOf.description: A implementer defined identifier. This can be used for local resource matching and has no business implication.
The Tillhub payment option resource reference ID.
The position of the payment item. E.g. positon 1 (2, 3 etc.) in the transaction.

date.description: A user defined [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) compliant date e.g. 2018-01-29T14:55:05.000Z. This is used to track local client time as oppsed to `created_at`, which is the time the server has received it. This is necessary for e.g. offline client, and is valid time in fiscal reports. If none is provided it will default to the transaction's date.

name.description: The nomenclature for this item, which is fiscally required.

currency.description: The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this item.

oneOf.description: The included tip amount.

amount_given.description: The actual over the counter money flow: regardles what needs to be payed e.g. 49.98, but the customer has given. This is usually of interest in cash payments, or when when customers gave fewer amount than they ought to pay.

oneOf.description: The amount that was requested by the POS e.g. 49.98, regardless of what was given e.g. 50.00. Hence the rest is change or tip. This is usually of interest in cash payments.
The cash amount that was handed back from the cashier as change.
Any custom ID, e.g. a rolling payment number
The Tillhub branch location ID. If none is specified we will use the one from the transaction.
The Tillhub register location ID. If none is specified we will use the one from the transaction.
Any external reference to a cost center e.g. in enterprise environments.
The applicable Tillhub account e.g for this payment type.
The applicable Tillhub account for the cash payment type used for change.
Any additional flat values.
Any arbitrary title.
Account face values.

terminal.description: If a terminal was used for this payment - addtional information will be stored here. NULL together with a card type indicates a disconnected terminal payment.

oneOf.description: The effective voucher delta record for this item (thus reversable if needed)

device_id.description: The Id of the terminal used. Style differs by Terminal-API-type.

transaction_id.description: The Id assigned by the terminal for this transaction.

api.description: The API used to talk to the terminal.

card_circuit.description: The detected card circuit as reposrted by the terminal (VISA, MasterCard, GiroCard etc.)

card_pan.description: The cards primary account number. *** on merchant receipts.

receipts.description: The receipt texts reported by the terminal.

raw_response.description: The raw response of the terminal for finalizing the card payment. Might contain additional information.

is_connected.description:
If true - the terminal was connected during the payment process and data must have arrived in the POS.
If true - a cancellation must be connected to the termianla as well.
If false - the terminal was used independently - responsibility is with the cashier to handle data properly.
If false - a cancellation will not connect to a device.

voucher.description: If a voucher was used for this payment - addtional information will be stored here.

oneOf.description: The effective voucher delta record for this item (thus reversable if needed)

client_id.description: A implementer defined identifier. This can be used for local resource matching and has no business implication. TO BE DEPRECTAED.

source_id.description: The Tillhub or Fleurop Id of the source voucher.

delta_amount.description: The effective change in the value of the voucher or it's creation amount $1.37 = 1.37.

delta_currency.description: The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this item.

external.description: Make this voucher to follow external logic

external_system_type.description: Define which voucher API implementation to follow

external_system_id.description: Define here whether this voucher system is an external one and which ID it references at the provider. E.g. a Tillhub Account can talk to another one, but permissions and this reference need to be set.

oneOf.description: Replace own accountId with external_system_id in requests when external=true, i.e. /vouchers/external_system_id/voucher_id. If external=false use accountId as usual, i.e. /vouchers/accountId/voucher_id

external_voucher_system_id.description: If using a parent's voucher system, this is the voucher system id of the delegating parent. external_voucher_system_id is to be sent in requests as a query parameter, whenever external_system_id (instead of the own accountId) is used in the url, e.g. vouchers/{external_system_id}/lookup?code=xyz123&system={external_voucher_system_id}.

oneOf.description: Additional parameter for external voucher systems, e.g. Fleurop Voucher Type specifier or id inside external system
If action_type is 'create' - a reference to the voucher template used
Title of the source voucher.

status.description: Client side recorded booking state of the delta operation.

date.description: The date of a Tillhub transaction that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: A list of Tillhub resources that this transaction is related to, e.g. an invoice object that tracks the lifetime of that invoice

items.description: Reference to a very different type of object (e.g. transaction to invoice or expense to safe)

id.description: A Tillhub resource that this reference links to.

oneOf.description: Any identifier a user wants to store in the transaction system. E.g. an ID in a third party ERP.
A generic reference container as a user defined object.
A container for storing arbitrary metadata. This might be altered by API.

insert_id.description: The sequential database insert ID. Consecutiveness is not guaranteed.

client_account.description: The Tillhub client account ID. Note: this will usually be a uuid v4, however you might receive a capitalised dash-stripped version of it, if you hold a legsacy account.

unix.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in milliseconds.
The Unix epoch timestamp in milliseconds.

oneOf.description: The time when the signing process was completed (ISO_8601).
The core fiscal signature data.
This represents the time of any inital signing request (e.g. start_transaction according to DSFinV-K, Fiskaly: time_start)
The actual signature from the signing provider (data for backwards compatibility)
Optional caption if the signature by itself will be printed as QR-Code
The extended signature that can be printed additionally (e.g. as QR-Code according to DSFinV- K vs. signature as string)
The formatting info for potential qr-code-data

payload.description: The original signing response by the signing provider.

oneOf.description: The stringified version of any raw response from any signing provider, e.g. a base64-string for Fiskaly.
The object version of any raw response from any signing provider, e.g. the respnse object from an Epson TSE.

request_payload.description: The original signing request to the signing provider.

oneOf.description: The stringified version of any raw request to any signing provider, e.g. a base64-string for Fiskaly.
The object version of any raw request to any signing provider, e.g. the request object for an Epson TSE.
ID of the register according to the signing unit. Will deviate from the Tillhub register UUID!
Internal counter of the signing unit (signature counter)
ID of the used signing unit (e.g. Fiskaly/Epson: serialNumber)
Public key of the signing unit according to BSI TR-03111
The algorithm type used by the signing unit
A string describing the local type of the signing process
A string describing the local type of the signing receipt
The raw input for the signing process (e.g. according to DSFinV-K defined per process type)
The transaction number according to the signing unit, required in final input data
The transaction id according to the signing unit (currently only Fiskaly: _id)
Optional error reporting
Internal counter of succeeding errors, must be reset on next success.
A container for storing arbitrary metadata. This might be altered by API.
The actual time a dsipatchable transaction was dispatched, e.g. an invoice has been sent and results in an oblicgation from that time on.
The first time any document was printed (also plain text receipts - to mark subsequent prints as copy).

status.description: The current signing status of this transaction. A regular transaction will receive the status `complete` immediately. When signing is requested `complete` will only be assigned after signing.

signature_type.description: Any allowed singing system provider as type.

source_type.description: The type of the source that was signed.
